body:
Thanks for reporting this issue. I haven't considered tmux when adding the keybinding, but it makes sense that there might be some conflicts here.

I'm not sure if there would be a way to fix this so that `C-L` and `clear` work, but it should definitely work to add a new keybinding, so hopefully that will fix it for everyone.

I've looked into which escape sequences are sent in `tmux` when running the `clear` command, just to check if there's something Alacritty could hook into to remove the errors and warnings when running that. Based on my testing, there's no nice escape sequence sent which would allow for that, so I'd probably just recommend adding a new key action which then can be used.

Just for documentation, these escapes are sent when running `clear` inside of `tmux` on my system:
```
[Unhandled CSI] action='l', args=[2004], intermediates=[63] -> Reset bracketed paste mode
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[1, 30], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [1, 30]
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[2, 30], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [2, 30]
[Unhandled CSI] action='S', args=[29], intermediates=[] -> Scroll up 29 lines
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[1, 1], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 1]
[Unhandled CSI] action='K', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Erase in line to right
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[1, 31], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [1, 31]
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[1, 1], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 1]
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[1], intermediates=[] -> Bold
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[7], intermediates=[] -> Inverse
[unhandled] esc_dispatch params=[], ints=[40], byte='B' (42) -> Character set United States (USASCII), VT100
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Normal
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[1, 1], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 1]
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 1]
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[1, 30], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [1, 30]
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[2, 30], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [2, 30]
[Unhandled CSI] action='S', args=[29], intermediates=[] -> Scroll up 29 lines
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[1, 1], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 1]
[Unhandled CSI] action='K', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Erase in line to right
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[30], intermediates=[] -> Foreground black
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[101], intermediates=[] -> Background red
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[37], intermediates=[] -> Foreground white
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[100], intermediates=[] -> Background black
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[30], intermediates=[] -> Foreground black
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[101], intermediates=[] -> Background red
[unhandled] esc_dispatch params=[], ints=[40], byte='B' (42) -> Character set United States (USASCII), VT100
[Unhandled CSI] action='m', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Normal
[Unhandled CSI] action='K', args=[], intermediates=[] -> Erase in line to right
[Unhandled CSI] action='r', args=[1, 31], intermediates=[] -> Set scrolling region [1, 31]
[Unhandled CSI] action='H', args=[1, 48], intermediates=[] -> Cursor position [1, 48]
[Unhandled CSI] action='h', args=[2004], intermediates=[63] -> Set bracketed paste mode
```

> Based on my testing, there's no nice escape sequence sent which would allow for that, so I'd probably just recommend adding a new key action which then can be used.

Yeah, no worries, I'm just going to do that. Maybe an option inside the config to disable the warning displayed on the bottom would be a good idea? I don't know.
@OkanEsen I'm not a huge fan of that idea. These warnings should be fixed, rather than ignored. Most cases this is something which can be easily resolved by the user.

Yeah, just gave it a second thought and I agree with you.

I think the issue can be closed, if that's okay.
I'll close it with the PR for the action. I'll open that in a sec.

issue.title: Add keybinding action for clearing warns/errors
issue.body:
Since running `clear` inside of tmux doesn't actually clear any part of
the screen, but just resets the scrolling region, the warning and error
notices can't be removed without quitting tmux or Alacritty.

As a solution, a new action `ClearLogNotice` has been added which has
been bound to Ctrl+L by default. As a result, Ctrl+L can be used inside
of tmux to remove the messages, even though tmux doesn't clear the
screen.

This fixes #1811.

body: I've opened the PR (https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/1814), feel free to test if this resolves the problem for you.

issue.title: Add action to clear all buffers for a specific pane

repository.name: zellij
repository.description: A terminal workspace with batteries included

issue.body:
Fixes #2081 (?)

I want to start a bigger feature contribution but I needed some easy task to get familiar with the codebase. This seemed like a perfect candidate.

It's just a draft anyway if for some reason this naive implementation is somehow not favorable.
Also I guess for the sake of fixing this particular issue, it makes sense for me to clear only `line_above`.
But this is the more accurate semantic for this action IMO. Let me know what you guys think.

Tested it locallly , worked as expected.
- [x] test manually clear action (`zellij action clear` for a trashed pane)
- [x] write a dedicated test for it (not sure I did it clean here)
